project.description: This job sends a command to a target AWS EC2 instance for docker to run a container against a specific image located in the docker registry in ECS.

secureScript.script:
def opendiv = "
" def checkbox = "" def desc = "If checked log output will be verbose." def closediv = "
" return opendiv + checkbox + desc + closediv

def opendiv = "
" def checkbox = "" def desc = "Docker image is not up-to-date at target ec2. Pull fresh image from the registry." def closediv = "

" return opendiv + checkbox + desc + closediv

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: GIT_REPO_URL
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: The git repository from which the target EC2 instance will pull the docker build context directories and scripts to run the docker commands.

secureScript.script: def url = "git@github.com:bu-ist/kuali-research-docker.git" return "<input type='text' readonly=true name='value' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace;' value='" + url + "'>"

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='width:400px;' disabled=true>"

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: GIT_BRANCH
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: The git branch from which the target EC2 instance will pull the docker build context directories and scripts to run the docker commands.

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='width:400px;' disabled=true>"

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: ECR_REGISTRY_URL
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: Indicates the location of the elastic container registry (ECR) where the docker image is to be pulled from by the remote EC2 server.

secureScript.script: def reg = '730096353738.dkr.ecr.us-east-1.amazonaws.com' return "<input type='text' name='value' value='" + reg + "' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace'>"

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace' disabled=true>"

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: REGISTRY_REPO_NAME
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: This is used to identify the name of the docker registry repository that the image is going to be pulled from by the remote EC2 server. The value is "core" by default, but remember that any feature images are found in the registry under a "core-feature" repository name. Unlike coeus, the docker image for the sandbox environment is no different from any other environment - it is run-time configurations that implement environment specific distinctions.

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace' disabled=true>"

org.biouno.unochoice.ChoiceParameter.name: VERSION_OPT
org.biouno.unochoice.ChoiceParameter.description: How do you want to enter the version value?

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: VERSION
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: This value reflects the git tag applied to the codebase the docker image in the docker registry is based on. The git commit may not be the exact commit that was tagged, but would be the most recent commit since that tag before the next tag is encountered. Combined with ECR_REGISTRY_URL, this value serves to identify the docker image inside the repository at the docker registry as it will have been already tagged accordingly.

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace' disabled=true>"

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: LANDSCAPE
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: What landscape is the target EC2 instance in?

secureScript.script: def sb = new StringBuilder("<select name='value' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace;'>") sb.append("<option selected=true value='sb'>sb</option>") sb.append("<option value='ci'>ci</option>") sb.append("<option value='qa'>qa</option>") sb.append("<option value='stg'>stg</option>") sb.append("<option value='prod'>prod</option>") sb.append("</select>") return sb.toString()

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace' disabled=true>"

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: EC2_INSTANCE_ID
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description: The id of the EC2 instance that will be running the container based on the docker image it pulls from the docker registry.

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace' disabled=true>"

org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.name: ROOT_DIR
org.biouno.unochoice.DynamicReferencePar.description:
The root directory where the git repo containing bash scripts and docker contexts is pulled to.
Need it here for supporting bash functions found in ./bash.lib.sh

secureFallbackScript.script: return "<input type='text' name='value' value='error' style='width:400px;font-family:monospace' disabled=true>"

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
[ "$(echo $VERBOSE | sed 's/,//g')" == false ] && set +x
# Need to get our hands on bash.lib.sh from github. ROOT_DIR="$(echo $ROOT_DIR | sed 's/,//g')" if [ -z "$ROOT_DIR" ] || [ ! -f "$ROOT_DIR/bash.lib.sh" ] ; then GIT_SCRIPT_URL=git@github.com:bu-ist/kuali-research-docker.git GIT_SCRIPT_BRANCH=master CLI=/var/lib/jenkins/jenkins-cli.jar HOST=http://localhost:8080/ java -jar ${CLI} -s ${HOST} build 'kuali-core-1-pull-build-scripts' -v -f \ -p GIT_REPO_URL=${GIT_SCRIPT_URL} \ -p GIT_BRANCH=${GIT_SCRIPT_BRANCH} \ -p ROOT_DIR=${WORKSPACE} [ ! -f "${WORKSPACE}/bash.lib.sh" ] && echo "ERROR! Cannot get bash.lib.sh from github!" && exit 1 source "${WORKSPACE}/bash.lib.sh" else # Content was already pulled by another job that is calling this job, so we need to source the script from the other jobs workspace. source "$ROOT_DIR/bash.lib.sh" fi
# Fix the trailing comma issue with active choices parameters reactive VERBOSE="$(echo $VERBOSE | sed 's/,//g')" BLAST_IMAGE="$(echo $BLAST_IMAGE | sed 's/,//g')" GIT_REPO_URL="$(echo $GIT_REPO_URL | sed 's/,//g')" GIT_BRANCH="$(echo $GIT_BRANCH | sed 's/,//g')" ECR_REGISTRY_URL="$(echo $ECR_REGISTRY_URL | sed 's/,//g')" REGISTRY_REPO_NAME="$(echo $REGISTRY_REPO_NAME | sed 's/,//g')" VERSION="$(echo $VERSION | sed 's/,//g')" EC2_INSTANCE_ID="$(echo $EC2_INSTANCE_ID | sed 's/,//g')" LANDSCAPE="$(echo $LANDSCAPE | sed 's/,//g')" DOCKER_TAG="${ECR_REGISTRY_URL}/${REGISTRY_REPO_NAME}:${VERSION}"
# Validate the job parameters [ -z "$GIT_REPO_URL" ] && echo "ERROR! GIT_REPO_URL cannot be empty!" && exit 1 [ -z "$GIT_BRANCH" ] && echo "ERROR! GIT_BRANCH cannot be empty!" && exit 1 [ -z "$EC2_INSTANCE_ID" ] && echo "ERROR! EC2_INSTANCE_ID cannot be empty!" && exit 1 [ -z "$ECR_REGISTRY_URL" ] && echo "ERROR! ECR_REGISTRY_URL cannot be empty!" && exit 1 [ -z "$LANDSCAPE" ] && echo "ERROR! LANDSCAPE cannot be empty!" && exit 1 if [ -z "$VERSION" ] ; then echo "ERROR! VERSION parameter cannot be empty" exit 1 elif [ -z "$(echo "$VERSION" | grep -P "^\\d{4}\.\\d{4}\$")" ] ; then echo "ERROR! VERSION parameter must be of format 'YYYY.xxxx' where Y and x are both numeric." exit 1 fi
[ "$LANDSCAPE" == 'prod' ] && CORE_HOST="kuali-research.bu.edu" || CORE_HOST="kuali-research-${LANDSCAPE}.bu.edu"
# Create an array of parameters to pass to the runapp function (see below). parms=( "\"interactive=false\"" "\"renew_configs=true\"" "\"root_dir=/opt/kuali-research-docker/core/build.context\"" "\"dryrun=$([ "$DRYRUN" == true ] && echo 'true' || echo 'false')\"" "\"docker_image_name=$DOCKER_TAG\"" "\"landscape=$LANDSCAPE\"" "\"core_host=$CORE_HOST\"" "\"blast_container=true\"" "\"blast_image=$BLAST_IMAGE\"" )
# Compose the code that is to be passed as a command with the ssm send-command call # # NOTE: Have to encode the command being sent to ssm agent because of quote escaping restrictions. # (jenkins removes double quotes and escapes single quotes and wraps command args with more single # quotes if they contain spaces, making it impossible to provide a string that is acceptable to send-command commands arg) GIT_ROOT="/opt/kuali-research-docker" BASE64=$(\ echo \ "set +x && echo '#################################################################################'; \ echo '###### 1) Obtaining the private key to get the docker build context from git'; \ echo '#################################################################################' && set -x; \ export AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=us-east-1; \ export AWS_DEFAULT_OUTPUT=json; \ if [ ! -f ~/.ssh/bu_github_id_docker_rsa ] ; then \ [ -n \"\$(aws help 1> /dev/null)\" ] && echo 'ERROR! The aws cli does not seem to be installed!' && exit 1; \ aws s3 cp s3://kuali-research-ec2-setup/bu_github_id_docker_rsa ~/.ssh ; \ if [ ! -f ~/.ssh/bu_github_id_docker_rsa ] ; then \ echo 'ERROR! Cannot obtain private key bu_github_id_docker_rsa'; \ exit 1; \ fi; \ chmod 600 ~/.ssh/bu_github_id_docker_rsa; \ ssh-keyscan -t rsa github.com >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts; \ fi; \ set +x && echo '#################################################################################'; \ echo '###### 2) Checking/preparing git configuration for pull of docker build context'; \ echo '#################################################################################' && set -x; \ [ ! -d ${GIT_ROOT} ] && mkdir ${GIT_ROOT}; \ cd ${GIT_ROOT}; \ if [ ! -d .git ] ; then \ git init; \ fi; \ if [ -z \"\$(git config --get remote.github.url)\" ] ; then \ git config user.email jenkins@bu.edu; \ git config user.name jenkins; \ git remote add github ${GIT_REPO_URL}; \ fi; \ eval \"ssh-agent -k\" || true; \ eval \"\$(ssh-agent -s)\"; \ ssh-add ~/.ssh/bu_github_id_docker_rsa; \ set +x && echo '#################################################################################'; \ echo '###### 3) Fetching docker build context from git'; \ echo '#################################################################################' && set -x; \ git fetch github ${GIT_BRANCH}; \ currentbranch=\"\$(git rev-parse --abbrev-ref HEAD)\"; \ if [ \"\$currentbranch\" != \"${GIT_BRANCH}\" ] ; then \ git commit -a -m \"Saving work on \$currentbranch before checking out $GIT_BRANCH\"; \ fi; \ if [ -n \"\$(git rev-parse --verify ${GIT_BRANCH} 2>/dev/null)\" ] ; then \ [ \"\$currentbranch\" != \"${GIT_BRANCH}\" ] && git checkout ${GIT_BRANCH}; \ git reset --hard FETCH_HEAD; \ else \ git checkout -b ${GIT_BRANCH} remotes/github/${GIT_BRANCH}; \ fi; \ eval \"ssh-agent -k\" || true; \ set +x && echo '#################################################################################'; \ echo '###### 4) Running docker run command...'; \ echo '#################################################################################' && set -x; \ cd $GIT_ROOT/core/build.context; \ source $GIT_ROOT/core/build.context/docker.sh; \ if [ "$VERBOSE" == false ] ; then set +x; fi; \ runapp ${parms[@]} 2>&1 | tee /tmp/last-core-run-cmd" | base64 -w 0 \ ) echo "BASE64 = $BASE64" echo "EC2_INSTANCE_ID = $EC2_INSTANCE_ID"
# Execute the send-command call COMMAND_ID=$(aws ssm send-command \ --instance-ids "${EC2_INSTANCE_ID}" \ --document-name "AWS-RunShellScript" \ --comment "Running shell script to pull and run container against a new docker image for ${REGISTRY_REPO_NAME}" \ --parameters \ commands="echo >> /tmp/ssm-core-received && date >> /tmp/ssm-core-received && \ echo ${BASE64} | base64 --decode >> /tmp/ssm-core-received && \ echo ${BASE64} | base64 --decode > /tmp/ssm-core-last.sh && \ echo ${BASE64} | base64 --decode | sh 2>&1" \ --output text \ --query "Command.CommandId" \ --output-s3-bucket-name "kuali-docker-run-stdout" \ --output-s3-key-prefix "core")
# The file output by ssm send-command won't be available in s3 immediately, so # making repeated attempts to access it in a loop until it is available. echo "COMMAND_ID=$COMMAND_ID" i=1 while ((i<100)) ; do s3Url="$(s3GetCoreSendCommandOutputFileUrl $COMMAND_ID)" [ -n "$s3Url" ] && echo "Url to presign is: $s3Url" && break; echo "Url to presign not ready. Trying again in 3 seconds..." ((i+=1)) sleep 3 done
if [ -n "$s3Url" ] ; then # Have the s3 url of the stdout file presigned so a we can access it with a new url that will get around # the private access restriction. days=10 seconds="$((60*60*24*${days}))" httpUrl="$(aws s3 presign "${s3Url}" --expires-in=${seconds})" echo "Access the docker container creation output on the remote EC2 instance ($EC2_INSTANCE_ID}) at:" echo " " echo "$httpUrl" echo " " echo "You may have to wait for about a minute for the link to become available" echo "(link expires in $days days)" echo " " else echo "WARNING! Could not acquire s3 location of ssm send-command output file!" echo "You will have to shell into the ec2 instance and open /tmp/last-core-run-cmd to determine how it went." fi
